dataset.title: Dataset: National total ecosystem carbon stock for the mangroves of Belize.
dataset.abstract: This dataset release presents the first national total ecosystem carbon stock values for the mangrove of Belize associated with the published manuscript, “Belize Blue Carbon: Establishing a national carbon stock estimate for mangrove ecosystems”. The Belize Blue Carbon project was a collaborative approach to comprehensive nationwide sampling of a range of mangrove ecotypes for ten mangrove sites and one seagrass sampling site. Sampling occurred in September 2021 and March 2022 along the full length of the Belizean coastline and offshore cayes, with species, distribution, hydrology, etc., varying between all sites for the highest level of representative sampling possible. Each site except two had two transects of six plots each [Hicks Caye had one transect for training purposes, and New River’s second transect only had three plots]. At the plot level (n = 111), almost 4,000 mangrove biomass measurements are condensed for average height, canopy width, and DBH, and also live, dead, and total biomass carbon, along with water quality parameters and site descriptions. At the sample level (n = 1356 for mangroves, n = 21 for seagrass), sediment core data are presented with loss on ignition, bulk density, and carbon values. These data supported the nationally determined contribution (NDC) update of Belize, and will be used to inform the country’s mangrove protection and restoration commitments.
dataset.intellectualRights: This dataset is listed under a Creative Commons BY 4.0 and can be used with attribution. https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Code indicating what type of device was used to collect soil depth profiles.

codeDefinition.definition: A half cylinder coring device in which the coring section is open, not sealed off by a fin

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether live roots were included or excluded from carbon assessments.

codeDefinition.definition: Roots and rhizomes were included in dry bulk density and or organic matter and carbon measurements

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating how the authors qualified or quantified compaction of the core.

codeDefinition.definition: Authors specified that the coring device's design minimized compaction

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density. This can include either samples that were freeze dried or oven dried.
Any notable codes regarding how the authors quantified dry bulk density.

codeDefinition.definition: Bulk density methodology did not specify drying temperature or length, only that samples were dried to a constant mass

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Time over which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Code indicating whether fraction carbon was measured or estimated as a function of organic matter.

codeDefinition.definition: Fraction carbon was measured as opposed to modeled

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether or not carbonates were removed prior to calculating fraction organic carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Carbonates were not removed before measuring organic carbon

attribute.attributeDefinition: The method used to remove carbonates prior to measuring fraction carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Samples were run twice in the elemental analyzer. Once with original sample and once with sample after LOI occurred, values were differenced to determine organic carbon.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method for which fraction carbon was measured or modeled (Note: regression based models are permitted, but the use of the Bemmelen factor [0.58 gOC gOM-1] is discouraged).

codeDefinition.definition: Each sample presented was measured using Elemental Analysis

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any other submitter defined notes describing methodologies for determining dry bulk density, organic matter fraction, and carbon fraction.
Minimum time over which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density.
Maximum time over which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density.
Indicates if sediment was sieved or ground prior to carbon measurements.

codeDefinition.definition: Sediment sample was homogenized prior to analysis.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Notes about plot inundation at the time of sampling.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Year of core collection.
Numeric month of year of core collection.
Numeric day of month of core collection.
Positional latitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Positional longitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Code indicating how latitude and longitude were determined.

codeDefinition.definition: Conventional Commercially available hand-held GPS

attribute.attributeDefinition: Habitat classification of the sampled location based on description or dominate vegetation.

codeDefinition.definition: Tropical and dominated by specialized shrubs or trees.
Intertidal to subtidal and dominated by specialized predominantly submerged grasses.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Soil porewater pH.
Salinity measured using a handheld refractometer (ppt) in porewater or as close to the pore water as possible if standing water was present.
Porewater oxygen reduction potential (or as close to the pore water as possible, if standing water was present) measured using a handheld combo tester.
Number of core sections retrieved for sampling event.
Maximum depth of sediment core sample.
Study-defined category of ecosystem type.

codeDefinition.definition: Offshore island site.
Mainland coastal site along edge of a river or creek.
Mainland site on edge of internal body of water.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Protection status of sampling site.

codeDefinition.definition: Part of a designated marine protected area or reserve.
Under standard government policy, not designated.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Notes about the protection status of a sampling site.
Overall health of each site, assessed in the field and classified by expert researchers.

codeDefinition.definition: Minimal disturbance with good mangrove growth
Sites with mostly dead or dying mangroves
Objectively healthy sites with signs of anthropogenic influence such as tree harvesting

attribute.attributeDefinition: Site description including relevant study details and political geographic units.
Transect identification code unique to each site.
Number of mangrove trees counted per plot.
Plot identification code unique to each transect.
Species that had the highest relative abundance at each plot. If tied, both are stated.
Total organic carbon in the full core taken from each plot (MgC ha-1).
Organic carbon in each core restricted to a 1m depth, as is IPCC standard reporting (MgC ha-1).
Total biomass carbon per plot, including live and dead aboveground and belowground biomass carbon (MgC ha-1).
Total ecosystem carbon stock, summing total biomass carbon and total sediment (full core) carbon (MgC ha-1).
Total ecosystem carbon stock, summing total biomass carbon and sediment carbon restricted to 1m (MgC ha-1).
Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Minimum depth of a sampling increment.
Maximum depth of a sampling increment.
Dry mass per unit volume of a soil sample. This does not include ash free bulk density.
Transect identification code unique to each site.
Plot identification code unique to each transect.
Percent of organic matter mass relative to sample dry mass.
Percent of total carbon in sample based on elemental analysis.
Percent of inorganic carbon in sample based on elemental analysis.
Percent of organic carbon in sample, calculated as the difference between the total and inorganic carbon.
Percent of nitrogen in sample based on elemental analysis.
Density of total soil carbon in sample (gC cm-3).
Density of inorganic soil carbon in sample (gC cm-3).
Density of organic soil carbon in sample (gC cm-3).
Total amount of carbon in core section (MgC ha-1).
Amount of inorganic carbon in core section (MgC ha-1).
Amount of organic carbon in core section (MgC ha-1).
Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Code associated with a species or a vegetation assemblage.
Aboveground biomass calculated using species-specific allometric equations (Smith & Whelan, 2006).
Aboveground biomass converted to Mg ha-1. Includes aboveground live, standing dead, and woody debris.
Belowground biomass calculated using species-specific allometric equations (Komiyama et al., 2005).
Belowground biomass converted to Mg ha-1.
Combined above and belowground biomass.

Aboveground carbon (MgC ha-1) derived from aboveground biomass. Conversion factor of 0.48 for live/dead standing wood. The converversion for dead standing wood was applied after decay correction for decay classes 1 and 2. Pieces in decay class 3 applied the conversion to the decay 3 aboveground biomass (Mg ha-1) value. Conversion factor of 0.5 used for downed (debris) wood.
Belowground carbon (MgC ha-1) derived from belowground biomass using a conversion factor of 0.39.
Combined above and belowground carbon (MgC ha-1).
Decay class as described in Howard et al. (2014).

codeDefinition.definition: Newly dead, little twigs present
Mostly larger banches present
Standing trunk only

attribute.attributeDefinition: Density of plot, espressed in per hectare.
Radius of plot.
Aboveground biomass adjusted for reduction in biomass based on decay class. Decay class 1 = reduce by 2.5%; Decay class 2 = reduce by 15%; Decay class 3 = reduce by 50%.
Dead tree volume (following Howard et al., 2014) used for decay class 3.
Diameter of tree at breast height.
Diameter of tree at the base.
Quadratic mean diameter (following Howard et al., 2014).
Dead tree biomass for decay class 3, calculated as dead tree volume multiplied by a wood density of 0.69 g cm-3.
Dead tree biomass for decay class 3 scaled up to megagrams.
Aboveground biomass derived from dead tree biomass (Mg) for decay class 3.
Wood volume (following Howard et al., 2014).
Indicates how wood volume (m3 ha-1) was calculated based on the quadratic mean diameter.

codeDefinition.definition: Calculated as ((π^2)*number of pieces*(QMD^2)) / (8*transect length)
Calculated as ((π^2) * [ ∑(each diameter^2) / (8*transect length) ]

attribute.attributeDefinition: Downed wood biomass (following Howard et al., 2014), calculated as wood volume multiplied by a wood density of 710 kg m-3.
Height of tree.
Width of tree canopy.
Code indicating whether sample analyzed for biomass was catalogued as live, dead, or debris.

codeDefinition.definition: Living biomass
Standing dead wood
Downed woody debris

attribute.attributeDefinition: Transect identification code unique to each site.
Plot identification code unique to each transect.

unit.name: nominalMonth
unit.description: one month excluding leap seconds and leap days, 2628000 seconds
